intro: Gironniera subaequalis var. brevistylis, commonly known as the narrow-styled gironniera, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy, pentagonal flowers that are typically pink to red in color. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks.
